Name: Omit
Description: When a ship does not call at a port included in the Long Term Schedule that was planned at the start of the voyage.

Name: Blank
Description: When an already announced voyage is cancelled. In this case the voyage number is retained and planned port calls are blanked.

Name: Ad Hoc
Description: An additional port call made on a specific voyage that was not originally included in the Long Term Schedule.

Name: Phase Out
Description: When a vessel moves out of a service at a given port from the latest issued schedule with vessel partners.

Name: Phase In
Description: When a vessel moves into a service at a given port from the lates issues schedule with vessel partners.

Name: Rotation Change
Description: When the sequence of port calls is changed compared to the proforma.

Name: Sliding
Description: When a vessel takes another position than planned in a service (i.e. due to relevant delay) resulting in one or more voyages to be cancelled or blanked.

Name: Cut and Run
Description: When the vessel will not complete all planned moves for the specific port call, but leave cargo- moves behind (discharge / or load- both possible) in order to safeguard sailing deadline from the port of call
